pages:
HealthNews of the Month
Click on each headline to read the full story.

Chiropractic as a First Line of Defense for Acute Back Pain
“I am an avid believer in the chiropractic philosophy, which places a strong emphasis on your body’s innate healing wisdom and far less reliance on band-aids like drugs and surgery.”

Daily chocolate may keep the heart doctor away
“Eating as little as a quarter of an ounce of chocolate each day, an amount equal to about one small Easter egg, may lower your risk of experiencing a heart attack or stroke, a new study has found.”

Risks Seen in Cholesterol Drug Use in Healthy People
“…statins already the most widely prescribed drugs in the United States, may not be as safe a preventive medicine as previously believed for people who are at low risk of heart attacks or strokes”

Lo-Sweet, Lo-Fat, Lo-Salt
“We’re not against applying technology to improve our nutrition. But we can’t help thinking about how skinny we were before the advent of Sweet’N Low.”

You have a special message from
Dr. Douglas Neuner

Tip of the Week

“It doesn’t matter if you go running every morning, or you’re a regular at the gym. If you spend most of the rest of the day sitting — in your car, your office chair, on your sofa at home — you are putting yourself at increased risk of obesity, diabetes, heart disease, a variety of cancers and an early death.”
